pullRequest.body:
Some little theorems relating `eraseLead` and `nextCoeff` to each other. Also includes `monomial_sub` and `card_support_mul` which could be of independent interest.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->
- [x] depends on: #9580

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

Part of #9052.

nodes.body:
> Note that you will need to fix `test.RewriteSearch.Polynomial`. What happened is that you changed what lemmas `rw?` finds and the tests expect a specific output. Shouldn't be too hard, although maybe @semorrison will want to be notified of the change.

Thanks for the heads up, but hopefully this can be fixed without my further attention. :-)
I've pushed a golf. Are you happy with it?

I mean I trust you! This golf looks like it changed many things, so I'm surprised... like, how did `Nilpotent` get mixed up in this? What's all this about `Monoid/WithTop` in there, is that something about how polynomial degrees are monoids with a bottom element...?

Anyway, I can't say I really follow, but I trust your judgement on the edits!
I added a few missing `WithBot` lemmas for simp to handle `degree` better, and that incidentally golfed proofs in other files. The `WithBot` lemmas are now in a separate PR.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#9580~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

If you are happy with it...

maintainer merge
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:

and similar comments elsewhere

Note that you will need to fix `test.RewriteSearch.Polynomial`. What happened is that you changed what lemmas `rw?` finds and the tests expect a specific output. Shouldn't be too hard, although maybe @semorrison will want to be notified of the change.

```suggestion
theorem natDegree_pos_of_nextCoeff_ne_zero (h : p.nextCoeff ≠ 0) : 0 < p.natDegree := by
```
Fixed this (and similar names) in new commit
That's just a trivial restatement of `nextCoeff 0 = 0`, right? Do you really need this?
Yup, oops

Actually - having it as a lemma is handy, since there isn't otherwise a `nextCoeff_zero` to just take `mt nextCoeff_zero`. I did golf it down to a proof term `ne_of_apply_ne nextCoeff h` which is not hard to write anywhere else. (I'm making this note partially for myself so that I can use `ne_of_apply_ne nextCoeff h` later; partially wondering if there should be a `nextCoeff_zero : nextCoeff (0:R[X]) = 0`.)

```suggestion
theorem natDegree_C_mul (ha : a ≠ 0) : natDegree (C a * p) = p.natDegree := by
```
Turns out there was already a `natDegree_C_mul` proving this exact thing, oops!
The power of the naming convention 😁
Can you put that next to `Polynomial.monomial_neg` and also prove `Polynomial.monomial_zpow`?

I'm not clear what `monomial_zpow` would be. There is `Polynomial.monomial_pow` already. `zpow` would presumably be for `(monomial n c)^(p : ℤ)`, but that isn't defined since polynomials don't allow for negative powers.

Such a lemma _could_ be defined for any `AddMonoidAlgebra F G` with `[Field F] [Group G]`, though?
Can you keep the list alphabetical?

```suggestion
theorem card_support_eraseLead_add_one (h : f ≠ 0) : f.eraseLead.support.card + 1 = f.support.card := by
```
and can you also provide
```
@[simp]
theorem card_support_eraseLead : f.eraseLead.support.card = f.support.card - 1 := by
```

The other one you suggest is pretty much the same as the existing
```
theorem eraseLead_card_support {c : ℕ} (fc : f.support.card = c) :
    f.eraseLead.support.card = c - 1 := by
```
and the proof would just be
```
@[simp]
theorem card_support_eraseLead : f.eraseLead.support.card = f.support.card - 1 :=
  eraseLead_card_support rfl
```
Does that still merit adding?
Can you just change `eraseLead_card_support`? This is a very weird statement.

```suggestion
theorem natDegree_eraseLead_add_one_of_nextCoeff_ne_zero (h : f.nextCoeff ≠ 0) :
```
or just
```suggestion
theorem natDegree_eraseLead_add_one (h : f.nextCoeff ≠ 0) :
```
if you think that's too long

```suggestion
    f.eraseLead.natDegree + 1 = f.natDegree := by
```

```suggestion
theorem natDegree_eraseLead_le_of_nextCoeff_eq_zero (h : f.nextCoeff = 0) :
```

```suggestion
    f.eraseLead.natDegree ≤ f.natDegree - 2 := by
```
and check you don't have extraneous spaces anywhere else using a regex like `\S  ` (it will have false positives, but not many)

```suggestion
theorem two_le_natDegree_of_nextCoeff_eraseLead (h₁ : f.eraseLead ≠ 0) (h₂ : f.nextCoeff = 0) :
```

```suggestion
theorem leadingCoeff_eraseLead_eq_nextCoeff (h : f.nextCoeff ≠ 0) :
    f.eraseLead.leadingCoeff = f.nextCoeff := by
```

Maybe better as
```suggestion
theorem nextCoeff_eq_zero_of_eraseLead_eq_zero (h : f.eraseLead = 0) : f.nextCoeff = 0 :=
  leadingCoeff_ne_zero.mp (leadingCoeff_eraseLead_eq_nextCoeff h ▸ h)
```
and you can use `mt` to get back your original theorem.

```suggestion
theorem card_support_eraseLead_one : f.eraseLead.support.card = f.support.card - 1 := by
```

Really? I'd go for

```suggestion
theorem card_support_eraseLead : f.eraseLead.support.card = f.support.card - 1 := by
```
Just lemme know which!
Sorry, my suggestion had a typo. eric's is correct.
Alright, changed to `card_support_eraseLead`.

```suggestion
theorem card_support_mul_le : (p * q).support.card ≤ p.support.card * q.support.card := by
```

```suggestion
theorem card_support_eq_one_of_eraseLead_eq_zero (h₀ : f ≠ 0) (h₁ : f.eraseLead = 0) :
```

```suggestion
theorem card_support_le_one_of_eraseLead_eq_zero (h : f.eraseLead = 0) : f.support.card ≤ 1 := by
```

```suggestion
```
Mind checking with `#minimize_imports` that this is all needed. I'm surprised you need so much more for a single lemma.
It seems needed. Although `Mathlib.Data.Finset.NatAntidiagonal` wasn't needed anymore, so I cut that out.
I have the impression this imports quite a lot of stuff. Does it makes to move this result somewhere else?

The only new import is `Mathlib.Algebra.MonoidAlgebra.Support`. (The `Regular.Pow` was already in the imports, they were just out of order so it got moved up a couple lines.) `MonoidAlgebra.Support` is only 150 lines, and its only import is `MonoidAlgebra.Basic` which is already being imported through `Polynomial.Basic` anyway. So the new amount of imported material is pretty minimal.
Oh, or are you saying that -- unrelated to this PR -- the `Regular` stuff seems to drag in a lot of imports and so maybe should be pulled out somewhere else?

I just noticed that `Mathlib.Algebra.Regular.Pow` starts with the sentence "Group powers and other definitions import a lot of the algebra hierarchy", and maybe we don't want `Mathlib.Data.Polynomial.Coeff` import a lot of stuff.
I pushed a slight rewriting of the two relevant lemmas. Not really any longer, but it lets it just use Regular.Basic instead of the 'expensive' Regular.Pow

> I just noticed that `Mathlib.Algebra.Regular.Pow` starts with the sentence "Group powers and other definitions import a lot of the algebra hierarchy", and maybe we don't want `Mathlib.Data.Polynomial.Coeff` import a lot of stuff.

This module doc is just wrong. Group powers are defined at the very start of the algebraic hierarchy. It's true that `Algebra.GroupPower.Lemmas` is a huge mess (and `Algebra.Regular.Pow` imports it), but #9411 is tidying this up and I'm betting `Algebra.Regular.Basic` will become the only import of `Algebra.Regular.Pow`.

This is a less precise version of [Polynomial.eq_C_coeff_zero_iff_natDegree_eq_zero](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Polynomial/Degree/Definitions.html#Polynomial.eq_C_coeff_zero_iff_natDegree_eq_zero) below, so I don't see the point of having it.
These existentials are sometimes useful because then you can `subst` away the polynomial, whilst if you have it as `p.coeff 0`, you cannot
On the other hand, this should certainly be proved in terms of that as opposed to a separate proof
I see, fair enough!
Here `b` can be replaced by `p.coeff 0`, giving a more precise statement (of course `a` is `p.coeff 1`, but I am not sure we want `p.natDegree = 1 ↔ p.coeff 1 ≠ 0 ∧ p = ...`
Same here, this is for `subst` purposes.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Lemmas relating `Polynomial.eraseLead` and `nextCoeff`.

source.title: Lemmas for Descartes' Rule of Signs. Notably `coeffList` and `IsCoequiv` as new defs.
